eurecom.gdfwriter

Class GDFWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.core.ExtensionModule
      • eurecom.gdfwriter.GDFWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, XMLStreamable

    public class GDFWriter
extends ExtensionModule
    This class saves the contents of spatial model in a GDF Data Model format.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jerome Haerri

      • act

        public int act()
        Executes the extension.

        The method is called on every simulation timestep.
        Specified by:
        act in class ExtensionModule
        Returns:
        0 - the module should be executed on next timesteps, -1 - the module should not be executed on further timesteps and should be removed from the extensions' list

      • packRecord

        public void packRecord()
        Writes the Record Buffers to the GDF File
        Once the complete record has been parsed, one or several (continuation records) string buffers may have been created. packRecord() simply print them in the provided output File.

      • writeRecord

        public void writeRecord(java.lang.String string,
                        int length,
                        char type)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes Records fields in the record string buffer
        If a record field makes the total length of the media record exceed 80 characters, a continuation record is created and the next string buffer has two Zero characters in the field which is used for the record type code.
        The rule for splitting record fields before a continuation records is as follow:
             A fixed length field should not be split.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be added to the buffer
        length - Length of the record field. A length = 0 means variable length.
        type - Type of the record field (numeric, alphanumeric,ect..)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if a buffer record has not been created
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the field is larger than the specified length

      • load

        public void load(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes the object from XML tag.
